blocks.text: Exercises 25—On the Solution of Spherical Triangles.
In each of the following cases, solve the spherical triangle ABC, given:
1. A = 72° 31′, B = 48° 13′, C = 85° 9′, and find also the value of B by the graphic method explained on p. 36.
2. If the sun's altitude is 19° 26′ 16′′ N, and its zenith distance is 71° 33′ 44′′ S, find the latitude of the place of observation.
3. Given a spherical triangle of radius 3,960 miles, find the area of the triangle in square miles.
4. If the semidiameter of the sun is 32′ 15′′, find the latitude of the place and also the hour angle.
